title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs inspired a Patriots rallying cry with his phrase 'we all we got, we all we need.'
The phrase motivated the Patriots, leading them to win 15 of their last 16 games and reach the Super Bowl.
Diggs, facing legal issues, remains a team leader, credited for his passion and ability to inspire teammates.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris, 34, from North Attleboro, is running her first Boston Marathon to support Massachusetts General Hospital Fund.
The funds raised will support emergency response, cancer care and research, and the Home Base Program for veterans.
Demeris's personal connections include her best friend, an MGH nurse, and her husband, an OEF veteran and first responder.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets in the South End will close in June after 28 years in business, announced in a Feb. 2 press release.
Although The Croft School initially planned to take over the space, they've withdrawn amid significant neighborhood opposition.
A Change.org petition with 1,500 signatures opposes converting the grocery space into non-retail use, urging city officials to preserve it.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: The Instagram account @DrakeMayeLover has amassed nearly 400,000 followers since its creation in May 2024.
The account, dedicated to Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, has posted over 1,000 times and sells related merchandise.
The account owner remains anonymous but might reveal their identity for a photo opportunity with Drake Maye.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality on Super Bowl LX's Patriots-Seahawks match, leading to mixed reactions from New England fans.
Nearly 700 Boston.com reader responses showed conflicted feelings; some disappointed, others understanding Brady's position and career shift.
Brady's neutrality is linked to his new roles as a broadcaster and Raiders minority owner, affecting fan expectations and sentiments.

title: Carlton Davis shares how Patriots will cover Offensive Player of the Year Jaxon Smith-Njigba in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' Christian Gonzalez will cover Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba in Super Bowl LX, according to Carlton Davis.
Smith-Njigba led the NFL with 1,793 receiving yards and won Offensive Player of the Year for the 2025 season.
Gonzalez allowed a 46.1% completion rate in the regular season and is considered crucial for Patriots' defense.

title: How Hopkinton’s theater community inspired one woman to run the Boston Marathon
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Carla Perrotta, a Lexington resident, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support the Hopkinton Center for the Arts.
Perrotta is fundraising for the center that introduced her to community theater, helping her feel at home in Boston since 2016.
The Boston Marathon marks Perrotta's second race, following her first in 2018, inspired by her commitment to the arts.

title: Newton Jewish day school places teacher on leave amid investigation into alleged inappropriate touching
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A teacher at Solomon Schechter Day School in Newton placed on leave amid inappropriate touching allegations and STI report.
Investigations by police, child safety authorities, and multiple agencies are underway; no criminal charges filed yet.
Teacher denies allegations; school reinforces safety policies and consults experts to review their student protection approach.

title: She’s running Boston in memory of her dad — and for families facing liver disease
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Renée Behrens is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to raise funds for the American Liver Foundation.
Behrens, from Niskayuna, NY, runs in memory of her father, Warren Behrens, who battled liver disease.
She aims to support families affected by liver disease while honoring her father's legacy and love for running.

title: ‘Maye Way, baby’: Drake Maye’s older brothers give him inspiring messages ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye receives inspiring messages from brothers Luke, Cole, and Beau Maye ahead of Super Bowl LX.
The video features childhood clips and emphasizes the Maye family's supportive and competitive upbringing.
Maye's brothers highlight their family's athletic history and encourage him to lead and show no mercy.
